page.title: 12INCE BLUNDELL HALL
page.content:
The most well-known building in the area is{Ince Blundell Hall.} It stands within the walled parkland on the edge of Ince woods. The "new" hall was begun in{1720}and completed in 1750. The hall contains many beautiful pieces of furniture tapestries, pictures and beautifully moulded and painted ceilings.
The{Pantheon}and{Garden Temple}were added to house the marbles collected by Henry Blundell between 1777 and 1803. These are now display in Liverpool museum.
The home is now used as a Convalescent Home, run by the Augustinian sisters. It is surrounded by beautiful gardens and walks.
